observations: Objects in the input move to the top of the output grid.
The top rows of the output match the shape and color arrangement of objects in the bottom rows of the input.
Empty space is filled with zero values.
The number of rows containing non-zero elements in the output is less than or equal to the number of rows containing non-zero elements in the input.
The relative positions of non-zero values are preserved.
hypotheses: Move all non-zero elements to the top of the grid, maintaining their relative horizontal positions and filling the remaining space with zeros.
Move all non-zero elements to the left of the grid, maintaining their relative vertical positions and filling the remaining space with zeros.

rejected_hypotheses.hypothesis: Move all non-zero elements to the left of the grid, maintaining their relative vertical positions and filling the remaining space with zeros.
rejected_hypotheses.reason: In example 1, the 7s and 2s are not moved to the extreme left of the output; instead they remain in their horizontal positions.

selected_rule: Move all non-zero elements to the top of the grid, maintaining their relative horizontal positions, and filling the remaining space with zeros.
step_plan: Identify all non-zero elements in the input grid.
Preserve the horizontal positions of these elements.
Place the rows containing these non-zero elements at the top of the output grid.
Fill the remaining rows of the output grid with zeros.
